Different Crime.Crime Name: Administrative Dispute over Band Council Elections
procedural_fairness: Referendum Band Custom approved by 83% of participating voters
Second Band Custom passed via show of hands without clear evidence of broad consensus
Irregularities in the Referendum Vote were minor and did not materially affect the outcome
decision_reasoning: Referendum Band Custom reflects broad consensus among band members
Second Band Custom lacks sufficient evidence of broad consensus
application_details: Judicial review application filed under the Federal Courts Act seeking declarations and writ of quo warranto
result_of_case: Court ruled in favor of the Applicants
Applicants are the rightful Chief and Councillors
Respondents' claim to office is invalid

cause_of_action: Dispute over governance and selection process
result_of_case: leadership review and election declared null and void

cause_of_action: Dispute over leadership succession due to conflicting elections and customs.
procedural_fairness: Judicial review of election processes, analysis of band customs, and consideration of administrative law principles.
administrative_decision: Two groups claimed legitimacy as Chief and Council.
relevant_rule: Administrative law principles, band custom, and electoral procedures govern the selection of leadership in Indigenous bands not subject to the Indian Act.
decision_reasoning: Council No. 2 was elected without following proper procedures, including seeking a writ of quo warranto.
application_details: A new Custom Leadership Selection Code was adopted by referendum, legitimizing Council No. 1's successor.
result_of_case: Court dismissed the motion, confirming Council No. 1's legitimacy and upholding the new Custom Leadership Selection Code.

decision_reasoning: violating long-standing customs
disenfranchising most members
conclusion_outcome: election is void and of no effect
